alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Fleming County through 200 PM EDT... At 124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cowan, or 8 miles west of Flemingsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elizaville, Nepton and Pecks Ridge around 130 PM EDT. Craintown and Tilton around 135 PM EDT. Flemingsburg around 140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Wallingford, Mount Carmel and Foxport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
